data.text: @kallmemeg @kallmemeg my son lost £500 through not working while positive. Now it's not mandatory several people at his work have carried on working while positive (inc the yard manager). No one's reporting positive tests.
@bidoogiri @kallmemeg mere luck is my best guess
@bidoogiri @RogerDobson14 @kallmemeg I never suggested testing is what resulted in negative tests

@savesnine1 @RogerDobson14 @kallmemeg That’s the point. You didn’t get infected, if I understand. Why not? 

I’ll tell you, it wasn’t because you were testing yourself a lot. 

I didn’t change much about my life other than wearing a FFP3 mask indoors — except for home, pubs, and restaurants. 

Doesn’t explain it.
@luimanna @kallmemeg You and I need to submit ourselves as case studies. There is something in there, I’m sure.

@kraster @kallmemeg @Johnincarlisle Not sure what you’re referring to?

Certainly the large study from Brazil demonstrates effective prophylaxis and at a small dose too (fortnightly).
@bidoogiri @kallmemeg I haven't caught it and for the life of me I don't know why. I have been careful but so have many of my friends who caught it. Same lifestyle too.
@kallmemeg Surges like this normally occur when restrictions are being lifted and “normal life” is resumed. We’re not out of the woods just yet.

@kallmemeg I recall 🇩🇰also use a "within 14 days of positive test" protocol for covid admissions.

Given incidental admissions are a product of spread in the community that surely suggests a dramatic undercount of UK cases in recent weeks?

NB testing has reduced by almost 3x in UK:

2/ https://t.co/ABeLl7e8t9
